definition: stupid/sluggish/clumsy/to wiggle (of worms)/to move in a disorderly fashion

sentences.english: Why did you bring that up ? you dumb-ass.
sentences.chinese: 你個蠢貨爲什麼要提起那件事啊？

sentences.english: A cheat may have his coat embroidered with metallic, chaussure pas che, yet it is a fool's coat still.
sentences.chinese: 一個蠢貨可以讓衣服鑲上金邊，但仍然是個蠢貨。

sentences.english: A cheat may have his coat embroidered with metallic, chaussure pas che, yet it is a fool's coat still.
sentences.chinese: 一個蠢貨可以讓衣服鑲上金邊，但仍然是個蠢貨。

sentences.english: You have liked many a stupider person.
sentences.chinese: 不過你以前可也喜歡過很多蠢貨啊。

sentences.english: They were bums, thinking about being in college for another 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 他們是蠢貨，想在大學再待個十年。

sentences.english: The white idiot writhes on his chair.
sentences.chinese: 那隻白貓的蠢貨在椅子上扭動着。
博士狀的蠢貨打壓着真才實學。

sentences.english: I heard you hooked up a rich idiot.
sentences.chinese: 聽說你釣了一個有錢的蠢貨。

sentences.english: A fool may have his coat embroidered with gold, but it is a fool's coat still.
sentences.chinese: 一個蠢貨可以讓衣服鑲上金邊，但仍然是個蠢貨。

sentences.english: A fool may have his coat embroidered with gold, but it is a fool's coat still.
sentences.chinese: 一個蠢貨可以讓衣服鑲上金邊，但仍然是個蠢貨。

sentences.english: The truth, sadly, is you chose jerks.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，是你可悲的選擇了“蠢貨”。

sentences.english: The foolish man gambled away all his money.
sentences.chinese: 這個蠢貨輸掉了他的所有錢財。

sentences.english: They were a bunch of sprout-eating whores.
sentences.chinese: 他們是一羣浪費青春的蠢貨。

sentences.english: The second time somebody calls you a horse, call him a jerk.
sentences.chinese: 第二次還是有人說你是匹馬時，你可以當那人是蠢貨。

sentences.english: Touching, dork, but you should really look.
sentences.chinese: 真感人哪，蠢貨，但你真該瞧瞧。

sentences.english: Even do you too feel that this sovereign namely stupid merchandise?
sentences.chinese: 難道連你也覺得本王是蠢貨？

definition: (dialect) hen/prostitute/(Tw) interfering/nosy/busybody (from Taiwanese 家婆, Tai-lo pr. [ke-pô])
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
